# timeRange

**Instance Property**

The time range of the track within the overall timeline of the asset.

## Declaration

```swift
var timeRange: CMTimeRange { get }
```

## Discussion

If the start of the time range is greater than [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreMedia/CMTime/zero], the track doesn’t initially have media data to present. This condition may occur when the media delays an audio track to align the start of audio with a specific video frame. You can test for this as the example below shows:

```swift
if track.timeRange.start > .zero {
    // Delayed start.
}
```

## Accessing temporal information

- **timescale**: The time scale for tracks that contain the `moov` atom.
- **naturalTimeScale**: The natural time scale of the media that a track references.
- **estimatedDataRate**: The estimated data rate, in bits per second, of the media that the track references.
- **samplePresentationTime(forTrackTime:)**: Maps the specified track time through the appropriate time mapping and returns the resulting sample presentation time.
